#Text=Canada 's Trinity — Spadina ( Ward 19 )
#Text=city council candidates speak
#Text=Saturday , November 4 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Trinity — Spadina ( Ward 19 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Nick Boragina , Joe Pantalone ( incumbent ) , George Sawision , and Hïmy Syed .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=George Sawision
#Text=50-year-old George Sawision is a master electrician and environmentalist .
#Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=My issues are based on a direct response by my neighbours .
#Text=Tax is a foremost concern especially the recent and future tax hikes that have been implemented .
#Text=My plan is still to limit or eliminate these increases by proper management and targeted spending .
#Text=The environment is also an important issue for me considering exposure to toxins has affected many of my fellow constituents .
#Text=Cleaning up the ward and taking proactive steps to reduce vehicle and other emissions is a priority .
#Text=Social issues in the ward including the homeless , child care and criminal activity are a focus for me .
#Text=However giving the youth and artists of the area
#Text=a boost by direct funding will bring new life to the area .
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=The role of councilor is an issue in ward 19 .
#Text=People feel they have been abandoned by the present councilor .
#Text=I feel a councilor should spend their full attention to the needs of their constituents first .
#Text=I feel that it is imperative that a councilor be available and proactive .
#Text=That is why my direct line is always available .
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=I have decided to run because I felt it was time to " put my money where my mouth is ! " .
#Text=It is n't effective to always complain that problems are n't being handled by those in city hall , I felt that I could make a difference for my fellow neighbours .
#Text=That is why I am not using tax dollars to run my campaign , to show that I am serious and devoted to helping my neighbours .
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=This ward deserves a caring and responsive councilor .
#Text=I was born in this ward , I have made my career here and I do n't plan on leaving the greatest ward in the city .
#Text=And now I want to return the favour and help my neighbours even further .
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=I have been involved in helping people not only establish themselves in the area but I have also tried to help people deal with government .
#Text=Everything from immigration issues to dealing with parking or property tax issues .
#Text=Sometimes its daunting for individuals to face government and I hope I have done my part to help .
#Text=Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=I feel the council decision to " clean up " Toronto was the greatest goal set by council .
#Text=Conversely it was also the worst because they did n't " clean up " Toronto , instead it seems items were swept " under the rug " into secrecy .
#Text=If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=As a new councilor I would begin by actually serving the needs of my ward .
#Text=I would go out of my way to ensure that the taxpayers money will not be wasted !
#Text=What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=Toronto is my home my life and I could n't even consider living anywhere else in the world .
#Text=I just do n't want to see Toronto ruined by un-checked development with no regard to future generations .
